dataclasses/predicates.js

  1. const { merge, mergeAll } = require('ramda');
  2. const $_type = require('./$_type');
  4. module.exports = ({ invariants, errors }) => {
  5.   const { Target, Operator, LogicalType } = require('./columns');
  6.   /**
  7.    * Abstract Predicate type, a Predicate is the union type of CompoundPredicate | ComparisonPredicate
  8.    * @typedef {object} Predicate
  9.    * @memberof dataclasses
  10.    */
  12.   /**
  13.    * Abstract Predicate type, a Predicate is the union type of CompoundPredicate | ComparisonPredicate
  14.    * @param {Function} type - Predicate subtype function constructor
  15.    * @return {dataclasses.Predicate} predicate
  16.    * @memberof dataclasses
  17.    */
  18.   function Predicate(type) {
  19.     return invariants
  20.       .PredicateTypeMustBeValid(type.$name, Predicate.Types)
  21.       .then(() =>
  22.         merge($_type(type.$name), {
  23.           /**
  24.            * $canBeRemoved specify if the predicate can be removed or not from the Predicates tree
  25.            * @type {Boolean}
  26.            *  @memberof Predicate
  27.            */
  28.           $canBeRemoved: true,
  29.         })
  30.       );
  31.   }
  33.   /**
  34.    * [description]
  35.    * @param  {dataclasses.Predicate} predicate predicate
  36.    * @return {Object} serializable object
  37.    */
  38.   Predicate.toJSON = function(predicate) {
  39.     if (ComparisonPredicate.is(predicate))
  40.       return ComparisonPredicate.toJSON(predicate);
  42.     return CompoundPredicate.toJSON(predicate);
  43.   };
  45.   /**
  46.    * @param  {object} json json
  47.    * @param  {object} internalAPI internalAPI
  48.    * @return {Promise<Predicate, errors<*>>} Promise
  49.    */
  50.   Predicate.fromJSON = function(json, internalAPI) {
  51.     if (ComparisonPredicate.isFromJSON(json))
  52.       return ComparisonPredicate.fromJSON(json, internalAPI);
  54.     if (CompoundPredicate.isFromJSON(json))
  55.       return CompoundPredicate.fromJSON(json, internalAPI);
  57.     return Promise.reject(new errors.UnknownJSONData());
  58.   };
  60.   Predicate.Types = {
  61.     ComparisonPredicate: 'ComparisonPredicate',
  62.     CompoundPredicate: 'CompoundPredicate',
  63.   };
  65.   /**
  66.    * Abstract Predicate type, a Predicate is the union type of CompoundPredicate | ComparisonPredicate
  67.    * @typedef {object} ComparisonPredicate
  68.    * @param {string} target - unique id for this target
  69.    * @param {string} operator - label that will be displayed for this target
  70.    * @param {string} argument - the type_id name this target has
  71.    * @memberof dataclasses
  72.    */
  74.   /**
  75.    * A specialized predicate that you use to compare expressions.
  76.    * @param  {dataclasses.Target} target target
  77.    * @param  {dataclasses.Operator} operator operator
  78.    * @param  {*} argument argument
  79.    * @return {Promise<dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate>} yield a ComparisonPredicate or a rejected promise
  80.    * @memberof dataclasses
  81.    */
  82.   function ComparisonPredicate(target, operator, argument = null) {
  83.     return Predicate(ComparisonPredicate).then(predicate =>
  84.       merge(predicate, {
  85.         target,
  86.         operator,
  87.         argument,
  88.       })
  89.     );
  90.   }
  92.   // by pass var. mangling from minify
  93.   ComparisonPredicate.$name = Predicate.Types.ComparisonPredicate;
  95.   /**
  96.    * @param  {ComparisonPredicate} predicate predicate
  97.    * @return {Object} JSON serializable object
  98.    */
  99.   ComparisonPredicate.toJSON = function(predicate) {
  100.     return mergeAll([
  101.       Target.toJSON(predicate.target),
  102.       Operator.toJSON(predicate.operator),
  103.       {
  104.         argument: predicate.argument,
  105.       },
  106.     ]);
  107.   };
  109.   /**
  110.    * @param  {object} json json
  111.    * @param  {object} internalAPI internalAPI
  112.    * @return {Promise<Predicate, errors<*>>} Promise
  113.    */
  114.   ComparisonPredicate.fromJSON = function(json, internalAPI) {
  115.     return Promise.all([
  116.       internalAPI.getTargetById(json.target_id),
  117.       internalAPI.getOperatorById(json.operator_id),
  118.     ]).then(([target, operator]) =>
  119.       ComparisonPredicate(target, operator, json.argument)
  120.     );
  121.   };
  123.   /**
  124.    * Yield true if `predicate` is a ComparisonPredicate
  125.    * @param  {dataclasses.Predicate}  predicate {@link dataclasses.Predicate}
  126.    * @return {Boolean} true if `predicate` is a ComparisonPredicate
  127.    * @memberof dataclasses
  128.    */
  129.   ComparisonPredicate.is = predicate => {
  130.     return (
  131.       predicate && predicate.$_type === Predicate.Types.ComparisonPredicate
  132.     );
  133.   };
  135.   /**
  136.    * Yield true if `json` seems to be a ComparisonPredicate
  137.    * @param  {object} json json
  138.    * @private
  139.    * @return {Boolean} true if json seems to be a ComparisonPredicate
  140.    * @memberof dataclasses
  141.    */
  142.   ComparisonPredicate.isFromJSON = json => json && json.target_id;
  144.   /**
  145.    * A specialized predicate that evaluates logical combinations of other predicates.
  146.    * @param {dataclasses.LogicalType} logic The predicate logic
  147.    * @param {Array<dataclasses.Predicate>} predicates predicates predicates
  148.    * @return {Promise<dataclasses.CompoundPredicate>} yield a {@link dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} or a {@link errors.CompoundPredicateMustHaveAtLeastOneSubPredicate} rejected promise
  149.    * @memberof dataclasses
  150.    */
  151.   function CompoundPredicate(logic, predicates) {
  152.     return invariants
  153.       .CompoundPredicateMustHaveAtLeastOneSubPredicate(
  154.         predicates,
  155.         CompoundPredicate
  156.       )
  157.       .then(() => Predicate(CompoundPredicate))
  158.       .then(predicate =>
  159.         merge(predicate, {
  160.           logic,
  161.           predicates,
  162.         })
  163.       );
  164.   }
  166.   // by pass var. mangling from minify
  167.   CompoundPredicate.$name = Predicate.Types.CompoundPredicate;
  169.   /**
  170.    * @param  {CompoundPredicate} predicate predicate
  171.    * @return {Object} JSON serializable object
  172.    */
  173.   CompoundPredicate.toJSON = function(predicate) {
  174.     return mergeAll([
  175.       LogicalType.toJSON(predicate.logic),
  176.       { predicates: predicate.predicates.map(Predicate.toJSON) },
  177.     ]);
  178.   };
  180.   /**
  181.    * @param  {CompoundPredicate} predicate predicate
  182.    * @param  {object} internalAPI ui-predicate-core internal api object
  183.    * @return {Promise<CompoundPredicate, errors<*>>} Promise
  184.    */
  185.   CompoundPredicate.fromJSON = function(predicate, internalAPI) {
  186.     return invariants
  187.       .CompoundPredicateMustHaveAtLeastOneSubPredicate(
  188.         predicate.predicates,
  189.         CompoundPredicate
  190.       )
  191.       .then(() => internalAPI.getLogicalTypeById(predicate.logicalType_id))
  192.       .then(logicalType =>
  193.         Promise.all(
  194.           predicate.predicates.map(predicate =>
  195.             Predicate.fromJSON(predicate, internalAPI)
  196.           )
  197.         ).then(predicates => CompoundPredicate(logicalType, predicates))
  198.       );
  199.   };
  201.   /**
  202.    * Reduce through the predicates tree
  203.    * @param       {dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} compoundPredicate starter node
  204.    * @param       {function} f accumulation function, f(acc, predicate, parents)
  205.    * @param       {T} acc               accumulator
  206.    * @param       {Array}  [parents=[]]      path to the node, array of parents
  207.    * @return      {T} yield the accumulator
  208.    * @memberof dataclasses
  209.    */
  210.   CompoundPredicate.reduce = function(compoundPredicate, f, acc, parents = []) {
  211.     const accumulator = f(acc, compoundPredicate, parents);
  212.     return compoundPredicate.predicates.reduce((_acc, predicate, i) => {
  213.       const _parents = parents.concat([compoundPredicate, [predicate, i]]);
  214.       return CompoundPredicate.is(predicate)
  215.         ? CompoundPredicate.reduce(predicate, f, _acc, _parents)
  216.         : f(_acc, predicate, _parents);
  217.     }, accumulator);
  218.   };
  220.   /**
  221.    * Walk through the predicates tree
  222.    * @param       {dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} compoundPredicate starter node
  223.    * @param       {Function} f(predicate) iterator function
  224.    * @return {undefined}
  225.    * @memberof dataclasses
  226.    */
  227.   CompoundPredicate.forEach = (compoundPredicate, f) => {
  228.     CompoundPredicate.reduce(
  229.       compoundPredicate,
  230.       (_, predicate) => {
  231.         f(predicate);
  232.       },
  233.       null
  234.     );
  235.   };
  237.   /**
  238.    * Yield true if `predicate` is a CompoundPredicate
  239.    * @param  {dataclasses.Predicate}  predicate predicate
  240.    * @return {Boolean} true if `predicate` is a CompoundPredicate
  241.    * @memberof dataclasses
  242.    */
  243.   CompoundPredicate.is = predicate =>
  244.     predicate && predicate.$_type === Predicate.Types.CompoundPredicate;
  246.   /**
  247.    * Yield true if `json` seems to be a CompoundPredicate
  248.    * @param  {object}  json json
  249.    * @private
  250.    * @return {Boolean} true if json seems to be a CompoundPredicate json
  251.    * @memberof dataclasses
  252.    */
  253.   CompoundPredicate.isFromJSON = json => json && json.logicalType_id;
  255.   return {
  256.     Predicate,
  257.     ComparisonPredicate,
  258.     CompoundPredicate,
  259.   };
  260. };
